p: Patients with chronic renal disease may have higher risk of poor outcomes given their altered response. We found that chronic renal disease was associated with death in influenza type B cases but not in cases of A(H1N1)pdm09 or A(H3N2). In a Spanish study of hospitalized A(H1N1)pdm09 patients, chronic renal disease was also associated with death [ 24], but another Spanish study [ 23] found no association in influenza B or influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 patients. In the study by Van Kerkhove et al. [ 30] in hospitalized patients with influenza and pneumonia between 2000 and 2012, chronic renal disease was associated with severity.
